A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Limited in ambition and scope\, yet also somehow far too long.  

The Fin/Rose subplot was boring.  

The whole\, "We have no fuel... so let's spend the entire movie trying to escape..." Really?  Why/how has the Resistance been utterly destroyed?  Context?

The characters are either soulless or make senseless/unexplained/strange decisions\, or both.

The backstory is more interesting than what's actually happening.  The Luke/Kylo history and Luke's character is the only redemption for me.
